alert.note: Alert for North Central Mountains; Northwest Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 20 at 8:50PM MDT until April 22 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 9 PM MDT THURSDAY FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS, NORTHEAST PLAINS AND THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR ALL OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Winds are forecast to trend down most areas Thursday, but will still reach critical thresholds across the Northeast Highlands and Northeast and East Central Plains. A more widespread and dangerous critical fire weather event is looming for Friday with strong to potentially damaging winds and very dry and unstable conditions. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau and the North Central Mountains Friday morning through Friday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 35 to 45 mph with occasional gusts to 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 7 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly and will be hard to control. Long range spotting and extreme fire behavior will be possible. Outdoor burning should not be done.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
